title: Gary Pearce (rugby)
text:
Peter Gary Pearce (born 11 November 1960) is a Welsh director of rugby at <a href="Hull%20RUFC">Hull RUFC</a> (2000–2005), and <a href="List%20of%20dual-code%20rugby%20internationals">dual-code international</a> <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> and professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1980s and 1990s. He played representative level rugby union (RU) for <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Wales</a>, and at club level for <a href="Laugharne%20RFC">Laugharne RFC</a>, <a href="Bridgend%20RFC">Bridgend RFC</a> and <a href="Llanelli%20RFC">Llanelli RFC</a>, as a <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Fly-half">fly-half</a>. i.e. number 10, and representative level rugby league (RL) for <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Wales</a>, and at club level for <a href="Hull%20F.C.">Hull FC</a>, <a href="Scarborough%20Pirates">Scarborough Pirates</a> and <a href="York%20Wasps">Ryedale-York</a>, as a , or , i.e. number 6, or 9, during the era of contested <a href="Scrum%20%28rugby%29%23Rugby%20league">scrum</a>s.
Background.
Gary Pearce was born in <a href="Laugharne">Laugharne</a>, Wales.
International honours.
Gary Pearce won <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a>s for <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Wales</a> (RU) in 1981 against Ireland, France, and in 1982 against Ireland, and won <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a>s for <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Wales</a> (RL) while at Scarborough Pirates in 1991 against Papua New Guinea, in 1992 against France, and while at Ryedale-York in 1992 against France. 1991...1992 1(3?)-caps + 3-caps (<a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Interchange">interchange</a>/<a href="Substitution%20%28sport%29">substitute</a>) (3-goals? 1-drop-goal? 7-points?).
